p.s: Yuca is a traditional South American cheese bread that is made commonly in Ecuador and Colombia .
This bread is made with yuca flour ( also known as cassava or tapioca flour ) , which is a gluten-free starch extracted from the cassava root .
Pan de Yuca is also often paired with a traditional fruit and yogurt smoothie .
There is even an entire restaurant chain in Ecuador called Naturissimo , which is dedicated to the " pan de yuca con yogurt " combination .
However , you can easily make this to enjoy at home .

item.s: 1 cup yuca flour
1 teaspoon baking powder
2 cups shredded queso blanco ( or any other white cheese , such as mozzarella or Oaxaca cheese )
2 egg yolks
2 tablespoons melted butter
2-3 tablespoons heavy cream ( or milk )
2 cups ice
1/2 cup plain yogurt
1 cup chopped fruit of choice
2 tablespoons sugar ( optional )
Preheat oven to .
Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil and lightly grease with cooking spray .
Set aside for now .
Combine yuca flour and baking powder in a large bowl .
Mix the ingredients together using a fork until they are evenly mixed .

figure.rend: How to make pan de yuca.jpg

item.s: Add cheese to the bowl .
Using the same fork , mix the cheese in with the flour mixture until everything in the bowl is mixed evenly together .

figure.rend: How to make pan de yuca 2.jpg

item.s: Beat egg yolks .
In a separate bowl , lightly beat the egg yolks , and then add them to the mixture in the large bowl .
Stir the ingredients together until mixture is even .
The mixture should now appear light yellow and chunky .

figure.rend: How to make pan de yuca 3.jpg

item.s: Add melted butter .
Mix well .
This should make the mixture slightly more clumpy , but it will likely still be too dry to form a ball of dough .

figure.rend: How to make pan de yuca 4.jpg

item.s: Add heavy cream .
Do this by mixing in one tablespoon at a time , until mixture is dense enough to roll into a ball .
This may also be substituted for milk , following the same instructions as for the cream , but will result in a slightly less dense bread .
Remove mixture from the bowl and knead on a floured surface until completely smooth .
Note that it will still appear chunky even when the dough is smooth because the cheese will give it a bumpier texture .

figure.rend: How to make pan de yuca 5.jpg

item.s: Divide dough into ten even parts and roll them into balls .
Place these on the baking sheet at least one inch apart from each other so that they have room to expand as they bake .

figure.rend: How to make pan de yuca 6.jpg

item.s: Place the baking sheet in the oven .
Bake for 10-15 minutes , or until the bottoms appear golden brown .
Note that pan de yuca is a very pale bread , so it will not appear as golden-brown as many other baked goods do when they are finished .

figure.rend: How to make pan de yuca 7.jpg

item.s: Poke a toothpick into the bread to check for doneness if needed .
Add chopped fruit and yogurt to blender .
Blend the fruit and yogurt together until the mixture is smooth and consistent .

figure.rend: How to make pan de yuca yogurt 1.jpg

item.s: Add ice and blend .
Blend the ice into the fruit and yogurt mixture to thicken the texture and chill the drink .
It may help to crush the ice into smaller pieces before blending , depending on the strength of your blender , to prevent it from getting jammed .
Add sugar ( optional ) .
If you wish to sweeten the flavor of the fruit , add sugar and blend well .
Serve in a glass and enjoy with warm Pan de Yuca .
You may want to try dipping the bread into the yogurt smoothie and taking a bite , as is traditionally done .

figure.rend: How to make pan de yuca with yogurt.jpg

item.s: Yuca flour can be found at a local Hispanic grocery store , and sometimes at other stores with international grocery sections .
Queso blanco is a typical Caribbean white cheese which can be found at Costco , Walmart , and Hispanic grocery stores .
Do not hesitate to use combinations of two or more cheeses in your bread .
Just make sure to use the same total amount of cheese in the bread for similar results .
